text:
Any chance I could see AD? Or even Max and Parker? I watched them all, event free last summer. It would be super nice if so, otherwise I’m all alone
today.
Thanks for your thoughtful consideration!
Message 3438 of 4024
I have been talking to AD this morning and it sounds like it's just video games on the agenda.
Mind if we play ping pong and have lunch together? I am happy to accommodate of course.
Sent:07/04/2024 at 11:39 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 07/04/2024 at 11:46 AM)
Subject:Re: July 4th
Message 3439 of 4024
We have plans. Thank you.
Sent:07/04/2024 at 11:47 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 07/04/2024 at 12:03 PM)
Subject:Re: July 4th
Message 3440 of 4024
Is there a way we can work on communicating better? We could have spent the morning together instead of him playing video games. Frankly, he has
no idea what's happening, so I assume it is not a big deal.
Plus, it can't be a tradition. The 4th of July was the biggest holiday of our year. Our tradition. The boys and I had everything planned, and the beach
camp was prepped early, ready to pamper MOM. It was our family's big day!
I guess I am just super hurt. You take every holiday, every break, everything. Even the things that were solely focused on us just chilling as a happy and
healthy family together and being thankful for each other. I have all the pics!
I feel like I'm dead to the family, and it's not right, especially after your secret 4th last year.
Sent:07/04/2024 at 12:17 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 07/04/2024 at 05:34 PM)
Subject:Re: July 4th
Message 3441 of 4024
So Bellevue downtown is going to be great. It’s all set up and ready for a show. Can I grab him?
You never do fireworks. You never even do the 4th. You’re from Hong Kong. This day is just always me trying to make us happy as a family, having us
all together at the beach or over bbq, to celebrate us and what we have done. Teaching the boys how to take care of a woman and make her feel
Sent:07/04/2024 at 06:03 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 07/04/2024 at 07:18 PM)
Subject:Re: July 4th
